content:
A while ago I blogged about Kenny Courser's thesis:

  • Open Systems: A Double Categorical Perspective (Part 1).

Now I've finally continued:

  • Open Systems: A Double Categorical Perspective (Part 2).

This time I finally explain all the problems with decorated cospans! A lot of work relying on them is broken. Luckily Kenny's thesis explains how to fix all these problems.

I just wrote a blog article continuing my explanation of Kenny Courser's thesis:

  • Open Systems: A Double Categorical Perspective (Part 3).

Last time I explained the problems with Brendan Fong's original decorated cospans - or more precisely, the problems with many attempts to apply them. This time I explain the "new improved" decorated cospans that solve all these problems.
